_exec_summary.SummaryText:
GENERAL EXECUTIVE SUMMARY FOR KIRSCHENMAN PACKING
                                              EDISON FACILITY, 12826 EDISON HWY, EDISON, CA

1.  ACCIDENTAL RELEASE EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES:

    KIRSCHENMAN PACKING IS COMMITTED TO THE SAFE OPERATION OF ALL ASPECTS OF THIS 
FACILITY, PROTECTING THE HEALTH AND SAFETY OF OUR EMPLOYEES, THE PUBLIC, AND THE
ENVIRONMENT. THE MANAGEMENT OF THIS COMPANY IS COMMITTED TO A PROACTIVE 
APPROACH TO MANAGING THE RISKS ASSOCIATED WITH THE HANDLING AND USE OF
HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. WE BELIEVE THAT PLANNING, MAINTENANCE, TRAINING, 
MONITORING AND RESPONSIBLE OPERATION ARE KEY TO THE PREVENTION OF ACCIDENTS.
WE TEST,  INSPECT AND MAINTAIN OUR EQUIPMENT ON A REGULAR BASIS AND OBSERVE 
AND DOCUMENT ITS FUNCTIONALITY DAILY. WE TRAIN OUR EMPLOYEES IN THE SAFE
OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF OUR SYSTEMS AND OPERATE OUR EQUIPMENT IN A
PRUDENT AND RESPONSIBLE MANNER.  WE ENDEAVOR TO BE GOOD NEIGHBORS IN THE
COMMUNITY, PROVIDERS OF A SAFE WORKPLACE FOR OUR EMPLOYEES, AND OPERATE
IN A MANNER THAT SAFEGUARDS THE ENVIRONMENT.


2.  STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES:

    OUR FACILITY'S PRIMARY ACTIVITIES ARE POTATO WASHING, SORTING, PACKING, STORAGE AND SHIPPING.
 
    THIS FACILITY USES CHLORINE,  DISSOLVED IN A WATER SOLUTION, AS A BACTERIAL CONTROL 
AGENT IN THE POTATO WASHING OPERATIONS, BOTH TO RETARD SPOILAGE, AND TO ENHANCE 
FOOD SAFETY.

    THE MAXIMUM INVENTORY OF CHLORINE AT THIS FACILITY IS 6,000 LBS.  A MAXIMUM OF 4,000 LBS
MAY BE CONNECTED IN PROCESS.  AN ADDITIONAL 2, 000 LBS MAY BE STORED AT THE FACILITY, 
BUT PLACED AND STORED IN SUCH A WAY THAT IT COULD NOT LIKELY BE INVOLVED IN A 
POTENTIAL RELEASE.


3.    GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND CHEMICAL SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS:

    THIS FACILITY HAS TAKEN ALL NECESSARY STEPS TO COMPLY WITH THE ACCIDENTAL  RELEASE
PREVENTION REQUIREMENTS OF 40 CFR PART 68 OF THE EPA.

    THIS FACILITY MAINTAINS DETAILED RECORDS OF SAFET

Y INFORMATION DESCRIBING CHEMICAL
HAZARDS,OPERATING PARAMETERS AND EQUIPMENT ASSOCIATED WITH THE WATER 
CHLORINATION PROCESS.

    PROCESS HAZARD ANALYSIS:  OUR FACILITY CONDUCTS STUDIES TO IDENTIFY AND CONTROL 
HAZARDS, USING A WHAT IF / CHECKLIST (COMBINED) METHODOLOGY.  THE MOST RECENT PHA
WAS CONDUCTED ON 12-21-06.

    OPERATING PROCEDURES:  OUR FACILITY MAINTAINS WRITTEN OPERATING PROCEDURES FOR 
ALL MODES OF OPERATION, INCLUDING INITIAL START-UP, START-UP, START-UP AFTER 
TURNAROUND, NORMAL AND TEMPORARY OPERATIONS, AND NORMAL AND EMERGENCY SHUT
DOWN OPERATIONS.

    TRAINING:  KIRSCHENMAN PACKING HAS A TRAINING PROGRAM TO INSURE THAT OUR EMPLOYEE 
PROCESS OPERATORS ARE COMPETENT IN PROCESS OPERATING PROCEDURES.

    MECHANICAL INTEGRITY:  KIRSCHENMAN PACKING CARRIES OUT MAINTENANCE CHECKS ON
PROCESS EQUIPMENT TO INSURE PROPER OPERATION.  PROCESS EQUIPMENT EXAMINED BY 
THE CHECKS INCLUDE CHEMICAL CYLINDERS, BUFFER TANKS, PIPING SYSTEMS, PUMPS,
SUCTION AND VENTILATION FANS, AUTOMATIC VACUUM OPERATED VALVES, EDUCTORS, AND
VEHICLULAR BARRICADES.  DEFICIENCIES IDENTIFIED ARE CORRECTED IN A SAFE AND TIMELY
MANNER.

    MANAGEMENT OF CHANGE:  WRITTEN PROCEDURES ARE IN PLACE TO MANAGE CHANGES IN 
PROCESS CHEMICALS, TECHNOLOGY, EQUIPMENT, AND PROCEDURES.  PROCESS OPERATORS, 
MAINTENANCE PERSONNEL, AND OTHER EMPLOYEES, AFFECTED BY CHANGES WILL BE MADE
AWARE OF CHANGES AND RETRAINED AS NECESSARY.

    PRE-START REVIEWS:  PRE-START UP REVIEWS OF NEW / MODIFIED PROCESSES WILL BE
CONDUCTED TO INSURE THAT CONSTRUCTION, EQUIPMENT, OPERATING AND MAINTENANCE 
PROCEDURES ARE SUITABLE FOR SAFE START UP.

   COMPLIANCE AUDITS:  COMPLIANCE AUDITS ARE CONDUCTED ON A REGULAR BASIS, AT LEAST
EVERY THREE YEARS.  THE MOST RECENT COMPLIANCE AUDIT WAS ON 12-7-04, AND CORRECTIVE 
ACTIONS COMPLETED IN A SAFE AND PROMPT MANNER.

    INCIDENT INVESTIGATION:  KIRSCHENMAN PACKING WILL PROMPTLY INVESTIGATE INCIDENTS
WHICH RESULTED IN OR REASONABLY COULD HAVE RESULTED IN A CATROSTROPHIC RELEASE

OF A REGULATED SUBSTANCE, TO IDENTIFY THE SITUATION LEADING TO THE INCIDENT, AS WELL 
AS CORRECTIVE ACTIONS TO PREVENT A RECURRANCE.  REPORTS WILL BE RETAINED FOR FIVE 
YEARS.

    EMPLOYEE PARTICIPATION:  KIRSCHENMAN PACKING BELIEVES THAT PROCESS SAFETY 
MANAGEMENT IS A TEAM EFFORT.  EMPLOYEES ARE ENCOURAGED TO EXPRESS VIEWS 
CONCERNING ACCIDENT PREVENTION ISSUES AND RECOMMENDED INPROVEMENTS.  EMPLOYEES 
ARE INVITED TO PARTICIPATE IN PROCESS HAZARD REVIEWS AND REQUIRED TO SUBMIT WHAT IF 
SCENARIOS TO BE CONSIDERED IN EVALUATING RISKS, BOTH TO ENHANCE THEIR PARTICIPATION 
IN HAZARD ANAYSIS, AND INCREASE THE PERSPECTIVES FROM WHICH THE ANALYSIS IS 
CONSIDERED. EMPLOYEES HAVE ACCESS TO ALL SAFETY AND HAZARDOUS MATERIALS 
INFORMATION  INCLUDING PROCESS HAZARD ANALYSIS INFORMATION.

    CONTRACTORS:  WHEN KIRSCHENMAN PACKING EMPLOYS CONTRACTORS TO PERFORM 
SPECIALIZED MAINTENANCE AND CONSTRUCTION OR TESTING ACTIVITIES, IT INVESTIGATES 
THE SAFETY PERFORMANCE AND POLICIES AND TRAINING OF THOSE CONTRACTORS AND THEIR
EMPLOYEES, AND EVALUATES THEIR PRACTICES AND HABITS.  ONLY CONTRACTORS LISCENCED 
BY THE STATE OF CALIFORNIA OR OTHER GOVERNMENT AGENCIES, AND OF THE HIGHEST REPUTE 
WITHIN THE INDUSTRY ARE EMPLOYED.

    CONTRACTORS ARE INFORMED OF POTENTIAL PROCESS HAZARDS, AS WELL AS EMERGENCY
PROCEDURES IN CASE OF ACCIDENTAL RELEASE OF A REGULATED SUBSTANCE.    CONTRACTORS
ARE FURTHER REQUIRED TO CERTIFY THAT THEIR EMPLOYEES ARE COMPETENT AND
KNOWLEDGEABLE IN THE PROCESS INVOLVED AND THAT THEIR EMPLOYEES WILL PROMPTLY 
INFORM KIRSCHENMAN PACKING OF HAZARDS OR POTENTIAL HAZARDS IDENTIFIED IN THE 
COURSE OF PERFORMING THEIR WORK.


4.  FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY:

    IN THE LAST FIVE YEARS THERE HAS NOT BEEN ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASES FROM A COVERED 
PROCESS THAT RESULTED IN DEATHS, INJURIES, OR SIGNIFICANT PROPERTY DAMAGE ONSITE, OR 
KNOWN DEATHS, INJURIES, EVACUATIONS, SHELTERING-IN-PLACE, PROPERTY DAMAGE, OR 
ENVIRONMENTAL DAMAGE.


5.  EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN:  

    KIR

SCHENMAN PACKING HAS A WRITTEN EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN TO DEAL WITH
ACCIDENTAL RELEASES OF HAZARDOUS MATERIALS.   THE PLAN INCLUDES FIRST AID AND 
MEDICAL TREATMENT TO DEAL WITH EXPOSURES TO HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES IN ACCORDANCE
WITH MATERIAL SAFETY DATA SHEET RECOMMENDATIONS, EVACUATION NOTIFICATION OF
EMERGENCY RESPONDERS, AND PUBLIC RECEPTORS.

    THIS PLAN WILL BE UPDATED TO REFLECT CHANGES IN OPERATIONS WHICH MIGHT REQUIRE
MODIFICATIONS.

6.  PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY:  

    THE ONGOING MANAGEMENT OF RISKS ASSOCIATED WITH HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES WILL 
LEAD TO INCREASED EMPLOYEE SAFETY EQUIPMENT INSTALLATION, INCREASED  SYSTEM 
SEISMIC STABILITY, AND CONTINUED EMPLOYEE SAFETY EDUCATION AND TRAINING.  THESE 
ARE SOME OF THE STEPS WE WILL BE TAKING TO IMPROVE AND MAINTAIN SAFETY AT OUR 
FACILITY.  CHANGES SHOULD BE IN PLACE BY 1-30-07
